subject: Law
title: Creative Commons Licenses
description: A micro-lesson that makes Creative Commons Licenses usable.

hook.text: A photographer uploads a stunning image and says: use it free, just give me credit. That's Creative Commons.

buildup.text: Creative Commons licenses let creators share their work while keeping some rightsâ€”a middle ground.

discovery.text: Six standard licenses exist, ranging from very permissive (CC BY) to restrictive (CC BY-NC-ND).

twist.text: CC0 goes furthest: the creator waives all rights, placing the work in the public domain immediately.

climax.text: Wikipedia, open-source projects, and millions of images use CC licensesâ€”powering a global sharing economy.

punchline.text: All rights reserved isn't the only option. Some rights reserved works too.

quiz.question: What does a Creative Commons license do?
options: Lets creators share work while retaining some rights
